channel.title: WSJ.com: World News
channel.copyright: Copyright © Dow Jones & Company, Inc. All rights reserved.

item.title: Iran’s Gen Z Helped Propel the Protests. They Paid With Their Lives.
item.description: A generation who grew up in a more connected world rebelled against a failing economy and strict social rules.
item.dc:creator: Feliz Solomon

item.title: Tourists in Japan Are Baffled: Where Are the Trash Cans?
item.description: One of the cleanest places in the world has almost no public garbage bins, forcing visitors to rely on coat pockets and backpacks.
item.dc:creator: Junko Fukutome

item.title: China’s Xi, Now Alone Atop His Military, Is the Sole Voice in Tackling Taiwan
item.description: Purges of top generals means China’s leader has a freer hand to deal with the self-ruled island that Beijing claims as its own.
item.dc:creator: Lingling Wei

item.title: Shake-Up Elevates U.A.E. Crown Prince Into $260 Billion Sovereign Wealth Role
item.description: The move marks a generational power shift in Abu Dhabi, one of the world’s largest state-backed investors.
item.dc:creator: Eliot Brown

item.title: Under Pressure From Trump, Nobel Peace Prize Director Defends Award’s Independence
item.description: In an interview with the Journal, Kristian Harpviken says the prize is inherently “complicated.”
item.dc:creator: Matthew Luxmoore

item.title: Venezuela’s New Leader Is Trying to Run Out the Clock on Trump
item.description: Delcy Rodriguez is slow-walking human-rights and democratic reforms, aiming to outlast Washington’s focus on her country as U.S. midterms approach.
item.dc:creator: Vera Bergengruen

item.title: Why China Cares About Being Cool All of a Sudden
item.description: The soft-power image makers in Beijing ride plushy dolls and YouTube influencers to win hearts abroad
item.dc:creator: Chun Han Wong

item.title: High-Profile Arrests Spark Exodus of Scam Workers in Cambodia
item.description: Thousands of people—many of them trafficked—have been let go from compounds in a shake-up of the deeply rooted “pig-butchering” industry.
item.dc:creator: Gabriele Steinhauser

item.title: How America First Risks Becoming America Alone
item.description: U.S. allies are growing increasingly disenchanted and insulted by the country’s aggressive foreign policy strategy.
item.dc:creator: Bertrand Benoit

item.title: China’s Manufacturing PMI Contracts in January
item.description: China’s official gauges of factory, services and construction activity unexpectedly slipped into contraction at the start of 2026, signaling a cooling in economic growth.

item.title: Trump’s Armada Is Getting in Place. Now He Must Decide What to Do With Iran.
item.description: The president has asked aides for quick and decisive options that don’t risk a long-term war in the Middle East. The ideal option would hit the regime hard enough that it has no choice but to accede to U.S. nuclear demands and lay off dissidents, officials said.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Ward

item.title: Opinion | A Tiananmen Memory Crime in Hong Kong
item.description: Three Hong Kong citizens face a decade in prison for lighting memorial candles.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Catherine O’Hara, One of Hollywood’s Most Beloved Comedic Actresses, Has Died at 71
item.description: The ‘Home Alone’ and ‘Schitt’s Creek’ star was a singular zany talent who valued the transformative power of wigs.
item.dc:creator: John Jurgensen

item.title: Why a Ruling Over CK Hutchison’s Panama Canal Ports Matters—and What’s Next
item.description: Panama’s Supreme Court decision has strategic implications for the U.S., China and the fate of a $23 billion global ports deal
item.dc:creator: James T. Areddy

item.title: Poland’s Economy Set to Enter Global Top 20 Following Another Strong Year
item.description: Poland is expected to supplant Switzerland, which hasn’t yet released its end-of-year tally. Poland now sits right behind No. 19 Saudi Arabia’s $1.3 trillion economy.
item.dc:creator: Don Nico Forbes

item.title: Zelensky Voices Support for U.S.-Backed ‘Energy Truce’ With Russia
item.description: An agreement to pause strikes on energy infrastructure would be the first tangible result from a renewed push for peace in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Anastasiia Malenko

item.title: Trump Faces High-Stakes Choice as Final Nuclear Pact With Russia Expires
item.description: Moscow has proposed a de facto one-year extension of limits on long-range nuclear weapons after a strategic arms treaty lapses next week, but the president has yet to commit
item.dc:creator: Robbie Gramer

item.title: Panama High Court Gives Trump a Win Over Canal by Ousting Hong Kong Port Operator
item.description: In a blow to China, the Supreme Court said CK Hutchison’s contract breaches the constitution.
item.dc:creator: Santiago Pérez

item.title: Yen Rally Wasn’t Government-Engineered, Finance Ministry Data Show
item.description: Tokyo didn’t deploy its reserves to aid the beleaguered currency at any point from Dec. 29 to Jan. 28, according to data released Friday.
item.dc:creator: Megumi Fujikawa

item.title: Ukraine Can No Longer Spare Its Youngest Soldiers From the Front Lines
item.description: A shortage of soldiers is Ukraine’s most serious challenge as it enters another year of war with Russia.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Luxmoore

item.title: Trump Threatens to Ground Canadian Aircraft and Apply Tariffs to Imports
item.description: The president says the move is in response to Canada delaying certification of U.S.-made Gulfstream jets.
item.dc:creator: Christopher Kuo

item.title: Cuba Is Losing a Key Oil Supplier as U.S. Presses Mexico to Pull Back
item.description: President Claudia Sheinbaum says her country will continue to show solidarity with Havana, even as its crude shipments plummet.
item.dc:creator: José de Córdoba

item.title: A Plan to Save Elephants Sparked a Deadly Conflict
item.description: The conservation project was supposed to rebuild the elephant population. It became a cautionary tale instead.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: Trump Orders Reopening of Venezuela Airspace, Eases Oil Sanctions
item.description: The new policies mark a shift toward normalizing relations following Maduro’s capture earlier this month.
item.dc:creator: Kejal Vyas

item.title: Opinion | Hamas Loses Its Last Hostage
item.description: The U.S. and Israel can press the advantage to demilitarize Gaza.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | Orbánomics Needs European Union Subsidies
item.description: Hungary’s Prime Minister bet big on green cars, like Biden, and now needs help from the people he loves to hate.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: A Secret FBI Bust Nabbed an Alleged Drug Lord—and Rocked Ties With Mexico
item.description: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum and FBI Director Kash Patel have told differing accounts about the role of U.S. agents in the arrest of former Olympian Ryan Wedding.
item.dc:creator: Santiago Pérez

item.title: China Agrees to Lower Tariffs by Half on U.K. Whisky
item.description: The U.K. government said it expects whisky exports to China to be worth roughly $345.2 million to the economy over the next five years as tariffs are lowered to 5% from 10%.
item.dc:creator: Edith Hancock

item.title: Opinion | The New Bipolar World of AI
item.description: Only the U.S. and China are ‘sovereign’ in that they can produce and maintain control of frontier systems.
item.dc:creator: Christopher Ahlberg

item.title: Opinion | Give the Board of Peace a Chance
item.description: There’s no guarantee it will solve the Gaza problem, but everyone else has already failed.
item.dc:creator: Daniel J. Samet

item.title: Middle East Scrambles to Find U.S., Iran a Diplomatic Off-Ramp
item.description: Efforts to get negotiations started have yet to bear fruit, while President Trump has renewed threats of an attack.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Ward

item.title: Opinion | Britain Seems Committed to Stagnation
item.description: The economy is flailing, and no one in the political class has a coherent agenda to revive it.
item.dc:creator: Joseph C. Sternberg

item.title: U.K.’s Starmer Joins Ranks of U.S. Allies Testing China’s Embrace
item.description: In a visit to Beijing, the British leader is seeking to rekindle ties with Xi Jinping, with a business delegation in tow.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: China’s Local Governments Cut Growth Targets
item.description: More than a dozen Chinese provinces have cut their growth targets for the year, stoking speculation that Beijing will follow suit and set a lower national goal for 2026.

item.title: A Battered Iran Is Still Able to Mount a Deadly Response to U.S. Strikes
item.description: Tehran has an arsenal of thousands of missiles and refined its tactics for using them during the June war with Israel.
item.dc:creator: Dov Lieber

item.title: How Trump’s Push for Peace in Ukraine Will Unfold: Three Scenarios
item.description: More war is most likely, but mounting strains this year could weaken Kyiv’s or Moscow’s hand.
item.dc:creator: Marcus Walker

item.title: Chinese Man Who Documented Uyghur Population Is Granted U.S. Asylum
item.description: The citizen-journalist, Heng Guan, drew attention after he was detained by U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement.
item.dc:creator: James T. Areddy

item.title: Syria’s Campaign Against Kurds Scrambles Trump’s Counterterror Policy
item.description: The failure to support the U.S.-backed militia could create an opening for Islamic State, White House allies say.
item.dc:creator: Robbie Gramer

item.title: Bank of Canada Rate Outlook Could Pivot on North American Trade Deal
item.description: The central bank warned of uncertainty in the economy, including the outcome of Washington’s review of the USMCA.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: Talking or Fighting, All of Iran’s Options Are Bad
item.description: President Trump’s new threats highlight how the regime is in its most dire position in decades.
item.dc:creator: Benoit Faucon

item.title: Spain Moves to Legalize Migrants, Defying Europe’s Anti-Immigration Trend
item.description: Spaniards mostly view immigration as beneficial, although far-right opposition is rising.
item.dc:creator: Cristina Gallardo

item.title: Xi Jinping Is Stripping Down His Military Command and Starting Over
item.description: Since mid-2023, at least 60 senior military officers and defense-industry executives have been placed under investigation, removed from public office or abruptly replaced.
item.dc:creator: Chun Han Wong

item.title: Key Gulf Allies Say They Won’t Aid U.S. in an Iran Strike, Limiting Trump’s Options
item.description: Saudi Arabia and the U.A.E. say Washington can’t use their airspace for a military operation against Tehran.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Ward

item.title: China Approves Purchases of Nvidia’s H200 Chip, Easing Tension With U.S.
item.description: Beijing gave the green light to Alibaba and others, but is keeping in place limits intended to encourage purchases of local chips.
item.dc:creator: Raffaele Huang

item.title: Venezuelans Suddenly Have Hope for the Economy. Less So for Democracy.
item.description: The U.S. removal of autocrat Nicolás Maduro has brought an influx of American dollars into the country, easing food prices.
item.dc:creator: Kejal Vyas

item.title: EU and India Reach Free-Trade Deal as World Responds to Trump Tariffs
item.description: The agreement is both economies’ largest and will link almost two billion consumers.
item.dc:creator: Tripti Lahiri

item.title: China’s Top General Accused of Giving Nuclear Secrets to U.S.
item.description: Bribery allegations have also been leveled against Gen. Zhang Youxia, whose downfall carries implications for the country’s military readiness.
item.dc:creator: Chun Han Wong

item.title: Crackdown on Shadow Fleet Escalates With Seizure of Ship Carrying Russian Oil
item.description: French forces’ boarding of a tanker signaled a more aggressive approach to sanctioned ships that move the oil fueling Russia’s war economy.
item.dc:creator: Noemie Bisserbe

item.title: Several People Missing After Landslide Buries Campground in New Zealand
item.description: Debris engulfed the site at Mount Maunganui following record rainfall. A government minister said young people were among the missing.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: Trump Wants Peace Board to Rewrite Global Order—but Major Powers Aren’t Sold
item.description: U.S. allies worry about joining an organization that could weaken the U.N. and give equal status to authoritarians such as Vladimir Putin.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Ward

item.title: Gilt Yields Rise, Sterling Falls as Political Uncertainty Resurfaces in U.K.
item.description: A local district election could usher in the return of Andy Burnham, reports suggested, providing a route back to parliament for the current mayor of Greater Manchester, seen as a figurehead for those on the left of the ruling Labour Party.
item.dc:creator: Renae Dyer

item.title: U.K. Government Borrowing Falls For Third Straight Month
item.description: The decline indicates the U.K. government has started to contain a rise in debts following a series of tax increases.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: Russia Cheers the Growing NATO Rift Over Greenland
item.description: Putin has long sought to undermine the Western alliance that he sees as a threat.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: Market Reaction to Greenland Tensions Has Been Muted, BOE’s Bailey Says
item.description: Bailey said markets were less volatile than might have been expected, but added policymakers must keep a close eye on developments.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: Can a U.S.-Greenland Partnership Work? Just Look at These Pacific Islands
item.description: U.S. agreements with three island nations have benefited both sides but have also had challenges.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: Pub Owners Turn Against Government in Britain’s Latest Rebellion
item.description: More than 1,000 pubs have banned Labour Party members over a plan to raise taxes. Even hairdressers are refusing service.
item.dc:creator: James Hookway

item.title: British American Tobacco to End South African Manufacturing
item.description: BAT South Africa said it would cease cigarette production in the country because of “the devastating impact of the illicit cigarette trade”.
item.dc:creator: Joe Stonor

item.title: China Imports to Help Lower U.K. Inflation to Target, BOE’s Taylor Says
item.description: The annual rate of inflation is likely to fall to the Bank of England’s 2% target by the middle of this year, aided by cheap imports from China, the rate-setter said.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: A Custody Battle Over Dogs Rocks an African Nation
item.description: Palace guard dogs are said to protect Malawi’s president from intruders and witchcraft. The outgoing leader decided to keep a few.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: South Africa Risks Angering Trump by Hosting Navies of Iran, Russia, China
item.description: The military exercises come at a time of already strained relations with the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Wexler

item.title: U.S. Escalates Venezuela Oil Embargo With Two Tanker Seizures
item.description: American special forces boarded a vessel that had been pursued for two weeks, while the Coast Guard seized another tanker in waters off Latin America.
item.dc:creator: Lara Seligman

item.title: Israel Flexes New Diplomatic Muscle in Recognition of Somaliland
item.description: Two years of war have honed Israeli independence on the world stage.
item.dc:creator: Dov Lieber

item.title: Modi Taps India’s Consumer Power in Trade Fight With Trump
item.description: The efforts of India’s prime minister to juice consumer spending and bolster the economy are showing signs of success.
item.dc:creator: Krishna Pokharel

item.title: India Is on a Himalayan Building Spree to Prepare for a Clash With China
item.description: A deadly standoff jolted India to stitch together a huge network of roads, tunnels and landing strips needed to move soldiers and supplies to the mountainous border region.
item.dc:creator: Ming Li

item.title: Bondi Beach Terror Suspects Condemned ‘Zionists’ and Amassed an Arsenal
item.description: Court documents reveal what police say were the movements and motivation of Sajid and Naveed Akram.
item.dc:creator: Jon Emont

item.title: Bondi Beach Shooting Suspect Charged With Terrorism, Murder
item.description: Police charged 24-year-old Naveed Akram after he woke up from a coma.
item.dc:creator: Rhiannon Hoyle

item.title: Bondi Beach Attack Badly Shakes Sense of Safety for Australia’s Jews
item.description: There has been frustration among Sydney’s Jewish community that authorities haven’t heeded warnings about a rise in antisemitism.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: ‘India’ and ‘Let My Country Awake’ Review: History at an Audacious Scale
item.description: Audrey Truschke’s single-volume work makes a bold attempt to capture thousands of years of cultural ferment on the Indian subcontinent.

item.title: Russia and India’s Complicated Relationship Hinges on Oil
item.description: The two countries’ reliance on each other in the energy sector is coming under strain.
item.dc:creator: Tripti Lahiri

item.title: The Best Travel Shoes to Make Every Trip Lighter and Easier
item.description: No matter the destination, these shoes will get you there.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Selinger

item.title: The Best Laptop Backpacks, According to CEOs, Pilots and Stylists
item.description: From commuting to long-haul flights, these are the bags avid travelers rely on for their trips.
item.dc:creator: Sal Vaglica

item.title: Best of Buy Side Awards 2025: Travel
item.description: Tried and tested by our expert travel writers and editors, these Buy Side best product award-winning luggage picks will ensure your trip gets off to a great start.
item.dc:creator: Nick Guy
